title: In Pics: Bangladesh On Fire, Buildings, Vehicles Burnt Amid Ongoing Clashes
content: Violent clashes broke out between students and security forces in Bangladesh last month over the newly reinstated reservation system for hiring in civil services. Around 64 people have been killed in this week due to clashes.
summary: Violent clashes broke out between students and security forces in Bangladesh last month over the newly reinstated reservation system for hiring in civil services. Around 64 people have been killed in this week due to clashes.

title: CrowdStrike CEO Says "Deeply Sorry" For Tech Outage: Report
content: CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz apologized for a global tech failure that disrupted multiple industries on Friday, vowing to work with all of its customers as they work to get their operations back online.
summary: CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz apologized for a global tech failure that disrupted multiple industries on Friday, vowing to work with all of its customers as they work to get their operations back online.

title: Protesters Set Jail On Fire In Bangladesh, Free "Hundreds" Of Inmates
content: Bangladeshi student protesters stormed a prison and freed hundreds of inmates Friday as police struggled to quell unrest, with huge rallies in the capital Dhaka despite a police ban on public gatherings.
summary: Bangladeshi student protesters stormed a prison and freed hundreds of inmates Friday as police struggled to quell unrest, with huge rallies in the capital Dhaka despite a police ban on public gatherings.

title: Taiwan Woman Makes Daughter Walk Barefoot On Hot Pavement, Internet Angry
content: Instead of buying her new shoes, she forced the girl to walk barefoot on the scorching asphalt road for at least 20 minutes.
summary: Instead of buying her new shoes, she forced the girl to walk barefoot on the scorching asphalt road for at least 20 minutes.

title: How World Scrambled To Deal With One Of The Biggest IT Crashes: 10 Points
content: Airlines, banks and businesses across the world were scrambling today to deal with one of the biggest IT crashes in recent years, caused by an update to an antivirus program. The US grounded all planes briefly; flights in other nations were affected.
summary: Airlines, banks and businesses across the world were scrambling today to deal with one of the biggest IT crashes in recent years, caused by an update to an antivirus program. The US grounded all planes briefly; flights in other nations were affected.

title: Fighting And Kisses: 5 Big Takeaways From Trump's Speech
content: Donald Trump's speech accepting the Republican presidential nomination lasted one hour and 32 minutes, the longest in modern United States history. Here are five key moments and themes punctuating the often rambling delivery.
summary: Donald Trump's speech accepting the Republican presidential nomination lasted one hour and 32 minutes, the longest in modern United States history. Here are five key moments and themes punctuating the often rambling delivery.

title: Why Some People Are Happy When They Are Dying
content: Simon Boas, who wrote a candid account of living with cancer, died on July 15 at the age of 47. "My pain is under control and Im terribly happy  it sounds weird to say, but Im as happy as Ive ever been in my life," he said before his death.
summary: Simon Boas, who wrote a candid account of living with cancer, died on July 15 at the age of 47. "My pain is under control and Im terribly happy  it sounds weird to say, but Im as happy as Ive ever been in my life," he said before his death.

title: Airports, Trains, London Stock Exchange, NHS Impacted By Global IT Outage
content: The UK's airports and trains experienced delays, with the London Stock Exchange and the National Health Service among the other organisations in the country dealing with the fallout of a global IT outage today .
summary: The UK's airports and trains experienced delays, with the London Stock Exchange and the National Health Service among the other organisations in the country dealing with the fallout of a global IT outage today .

title: Major Tech Outages In Recent Years
content: A global tech outage was disrupting operations across multiple industries on Friday, with airlines halting flights, some broadcasters off air and services from banking to healthcare hit by system problems.
summary: A global tech outage was disrupting operations across multiple industries on Friday, with airlines halting flights, some broadcasters off air and services from banking to healthcare hit by system problems.

title: Watch: Drone Whizzes Across Skyline In Israel, Hits Building Near US Embassy
content: Hours after a building near the US embassy in Tel Aviv came under attack, Israeli organisations have posted dramatic footage of a drone flying across the city's skyline and zoning in on its target.
summary: Hours after a building near the US embassy in Tel Aviv came under attack, Israeli organisations have posted dramatic footage of a drone flying across the city's skyline and zoning in on its target.

title: Pakistan Arrests Osama Bin Laden's "Close Associate"
content: Pakistani authorities said Friday they had arrested a "close associate" of Al-Qaeda founder and mastermind of the 9/11 attacks Osama Bin Laden.
summary: Pakistani authorities said Friday they had arrested a "close associate" of Al-Qaeda founder and mastermind of the 9/11 attacks Osama Bin Laden.

title: Microsoft Outage "Affecting IT Operations" Paris Olympics Organisers
content: Paris Olympics organisers said on Friday they were experiencing problems linked to a major worldwide computer systems outage, a week before the Games' opening ceremony takes place.
summary: Paris Olympics organisers said on Friday they were experiencing problems linked to a major worldwide computer systems outage, a week before the Games' opening ceremony takes place.

title: Opinion: Biden Or Trump, It's Still A Long Wait For Indian 'Dreamers' In US
content: Around 2,000 of "dreamers" in the US are Indian, and they are now eligible to apply for employment-based visas, like the H1-B.
summary: Around 2,000 of "dreamers" in the US are Indian, and they are now eligible to apply for employment-based visas, like the H1-B.

title: In 1st Statement After Outage, CrowdStrike CEO Says...
content: In its first statement after the massive Microsoft outage caused by an update to CrowdStrike 'Falcon Sensor', the security firm's CEO has said the issue has been isolated and a fix has been deployed.
summary: In its first statement after the massive Microsoft outage caused by an update to CrowdStrike 'Falcon Sensor', the security firm's CEO has said the issue has been isolated and a fix has been deployed.

title: Watch: US Robber Livestreams High-Speed Chase With Baby In The Back Seat
content: During the chase, the suspect livestreamed himself evading the police, while a woman in the background pleaded with him to let her and their baby out of the car.
summary: During the chase, the suspect livestreamed himself evading the police, while a woman in the background pleaded with him to let her and their baby out of the car.

title: Y2K Bug: The Last Time There Was A Global PC Outage Of This Scale
content: Just like the Y2K bug had the world on edge at the turn of the millennium, Windows users on Friday experienced a similar sense of panic.
summary: Just like the Y2K bug had the world on edge at the turn of the millennium, Windows users on Friday experienced a similar sense of panic.

title: Steve Jobs' "3rd-Rate Products" Jab Goes Viral Amid Microsoft Outage
content: Microsoft makes "third-rate products" - Apple co-founder Steve Jobs' damning assessment of the Seattle-based software giant, made back in 1995, went viral Friday as the company battles a major Windows outage issue.
summary: Microsoft makes "third-rate products" - Apple co-founder Steve Jobs' damning assessment of the Seattle-based software giant, made back in 1995, went viral Friday as the company battles a major Windows outage issue.

title: Halfway Through The Current Solar Cycle, The Sun Is Starting Its Next
content: Even though the Sun is just halfway through its current cycle, the first rumblings of its next 11-year solar cycle have been detected in sound waves within it, according to a team of researchers.
summary: Even though the Sun is just halfway through its current cycle, the first rumblings of its next 11-year solar cycle have been detected in sound waves within it, according to a team of researchers.

title: Fliers Get Handwritten Boarding Passes After Microsoft Outage Hits Systems
content: With a global Microsoft outage hitting tech systems in airports across the world, air carriers in India are checking in passengers manually.
summary: With a global Microsoft outage hitting tech systems in airports across the world, air carriers in India are checking in passengers manually.

title: Windows Showing Blue Screen Of Death Error? Here's How You Can Fix It
content: Windows users worldwide are experiencing the dreaded Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) error, causing their systems to suddenly shut down or restart.
summary: Windows users worldwide are experiencing the dreaded Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) error, causing their systems to suddenly shut down or restart.
